title: Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer
text:
Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer Published: Friday, October 16, 2015, 1:59 [IST] 
Ram Charan 's Bruce Lee has released with great buzz and a greater burden of pulling off the huge release. Read the review to know the fate of the film. Bruce Lee - The Fighter (U/A): Book Your Tickets Right Away! Bruce Lee Story: 
The story majorly revolves around Kartik (Ram Charan) and his sister(Kriti Karabandha). Rao Ramesh plays a lower middle class father, who can only afford the studies of either of the child. Understanding his father's limitations as well as dreams, Kartik though was a bright student, sacrifices his schooling to see her sister reach her goals. 
What else did the young champ do for his family? Did his father understand Karthik's sacrifices? Did Karthik's sister reach her goals? These locks lead the rest of the story. Performances: 
Ram Charan has got a role of his age to play, unlike his other films, where he always carry the burden of leading the society on his shoulders. His relaxed body language, naturally gifted style, guileless characterization added the beauty to his role. He was quite emotive in sentimental scenes and he danced like a dream in almost every song. Chiranjeevi takes back all the attention with his 5 minutes role and his screen presence leave you awestruck. 
Rakul Preet Singh was good enough for her limited role and she charmed in songs. Kriti, Rao Ramesh, Arun Vijay, Sampath, Tisca, Amitash and Nadhiya excelled even in their minimal screen time. Brahmandam, Posani and Vennala Kishore did not leave any impact. Ali, Jaya Prakash Narayan managed to tickle but were loud most of the times. Technical Aspects: 
It is understood that director Sreenu Vaitla tried to break the monotony but has somewhere disappointed in delivering what he is expected to offer. The emotional connect was well blended in the plot, which gave a scope for the director to extract wide variety of performances from the actors. 
However, mediocre comedy tracks from a 'touted to be a comedy entertainer' and that too coming it from the comedy's care of address Sreenu Vaitla is a let down in itself. Otherwise, Bruce Lee is stuffed with right 'meter' of commercial elements, which will make fans and the masses go bonkers. 
Cinematography, Dance choreography and the production values stands out while Thaman deserves a hand down for his massy tracks and powerful back ground scores. Writers Kona Venkat, Gopi Mohan filled the film with their trade mark one liners. Overview: 
Sreenu Vaitla's Bruce Lee could rather be called as a 'Mega' offering and we are sure this 'meter' will energize your festive mood with its 'Mega Power' full entertainment. Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer 1/9 Introduction 
Ram Charn will be introduced in a cop get up and he looked ravishing in the police dress. Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer 2/9 Styling 
Ram Charn's styling deserves a special mention in the film and it is quite a shocker to know he actually styled himself. Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer 3/9 Anal Arusu 
Anal arusu stylish and grand fights compositions were apt for the hero's characterization and the movie title. Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer 4/9 Rakul 
Rakul looked her best in the film and has complimented the hero very well in funny scenes. Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer 5/9 Chiranjeevi 
He looked half his age and his amazing screen presence is a gift to Bruce Lee. Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer 6/9 
Sister sentiment scenes worked really well between Kriti and Ram Charan. Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer 7/9 Cameo 
Bruce Lee ends on a high note, after Chiranjeevi's 5 mins act and it will make you leave the screen with some kind of energy. Bruce Lee Movie Review: MEGA Entertainer 8/9
